intro: Spuriopimpinella, commonly known as the common whitlowgrass, is a flowering plant in the family Papaveraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinctive hairy texture. Spuriopimpinella is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat skin conditions and as a poultice for wounds.
